title: Mesambria (Aegean Sea)
text:
Mesambria (), or Mesembria (Μεσημβρία), was an <a href="ancient%20Greek">ancient Greek</a> city located in <a href="ancient%20Thrace">ancient Thrace</a>, on the coast of the <a href="Aegean%20Sea">Aegean Sea</a>. 
According to <a href="Herodotus">Herodotus</a>, it was a bastion that had been founded by <a href="Samothrace">Samothrace</a>, was a neighbor of the city of <a href="Stryme%20%28city%29">Stryme</a> and in the middle of the two ran the <a href="Lissus%20River">Lissus River</a>. The <a href="Achaemenid%20army">army</a> of <a href="Xerxes%20I">Xerxes</a> passed Mesambria during the expedition against Greece in 480 BCE.
Its site is tentatively located near <a href="Shabla-Dere">Shabla-Dere</a>, west of <a href="Alexandroupolis">Alexandroupolis</a>; but it has been suggested that Mesambria could be identified with <a href="Drys%20%28Thrace%29">Drys</a>, or with <a href="Orthagoria">Orthagoria</a>, or with <a href="Zone%20%28Thrace%29">Zone</a>.
